body_html: But I doubt that will make a difference, because what keras creates an in memory queue of training batches, so that a batch doesn't have to be fetched from the hard disk once training on another batch is complete. I am assuming pytorch would be doing something like that too.So it shouldn't make such a huge difference.

I am assuming pytorch would be doing something like that too.So it shouldn't make such a huge difference.
body: But I doubt that will make a difference, because what keras creates an in memory queue of training batches, so that a batch doesn't have to be fetched from the hard disk once training on another batch is complete. I am assuming pytorch would be doing something like that too.So it shouldn't make such a huge difference.
